values: i hate myspace. it sucks balls. it never wants to work when i reeeeallly want it to. so here i am in live journal land. and i feel like i have to beg forgiveness of an ex-lover, whom i left for a younger, cooler lover. anyway, here's pictures: this is what it looks like when i go swimming in my bra: this is what it looks like when i get to have a slurpee: this is what it looks like when there is a cuddle party in my bed: this is what my bed face looks like: this is what bridget and i look like when we're being adorable: this is what it looks like when the ladies and i go to west hollywood: which only really happens once in a blue moon, like bridget coming to town... this is what THAT looks like: this is what my car looks like when i go to pirate themed birthday partys at the pirate adventure place: this is what we look like outside of the pirate adventure show: (please note the look on megans face. hahahaha) this is what it looks like when you put together two teenage boys and three hot lesbians: and for those of you who could give two shits about the rest of my pictures...here's a bucket of puppies...this is what they look like:

i'm a horrible horrible ljer. i'm hanging in there. things are mostly decent. i applied to school. i've lost 145 pounds. i'm pretty hopeless over someone i'm super close to (who is pretty much completely emotionally unavailable.) i've got to get my head straight on this one. i spend too much time on myspace. not enough on lj. i have an absolutely AMAZING crew. my favorite things about today: joel now lives on my coast and i will be seeing him at the end of september because i'm roadtrippin with some of my ladies. mia and seth got married. and i got to see pictures. and they're pretty much adorable. i leave you with?? photos:

hmm...so an actual update. things in my world are good. i'd venture to say great or wonderful, but that could be pushing it. i have some really good friends and i think daily about how blessed i am to have them. bridget visited this weekend and we had a really chill, fun time. i've been spending a ton of time not at home. hanging out , going out. i'm waiting on a job with the school system. it's a sure thing, but now that it's summer everything has slowed down. i'm still losing weight, amazingly enough. i'm feeling really good about that and about myself. i haven't weighed myself lately, but i know it's pretty significant because of the reactions i'm getting from people and my energy level, forsure. and there's kind of maybe sorta...a girl. not anything serious. i kind of dig her even though she isn't really my type. and we're both scorpios...which is kind of frightening. i don't know...some days i like her. some days i'm just frustrated and and i hate her and am all about the FTB. but it's been forever since i've been willing to even put myself out there at all. so it's good. so that what's going on with me in a nutshell... tomorrow i'm going to try to go camping. this is so rambly and scatter-brained. sorry, i'm out of LJ practice. me and my cutie nieces on mother's day in san diego. me and dani mae. at a birthday party with my friends heather and jenny on 4-20. camping with amanda. dancin' at moonshadow. i guess that's it for now.

tomorrow morning at 5 i'm going with five other ladies the go to my church (from age 16 to in their 50's) to DC for this. i'm excited and a little nervous because i've never been to something like it before. if you're going to be in DC or feel like going there and you want to meet up or something...call my cell (818)800-2375.

a week ago i joined the Y.  i went in the locker room today and realized that they had a scale and it went up to 400lbs.  when i got my surgery fixed, a while back, i weighed around 465 pounds. i know that i've been losing because really, i've just been eating less and all my clothes are bigger and that kind of stuff...i figured i'd give it a try, maybe just maybe i was under 400.

it said 367. i've lost 100 pounds.  :)
my mom just came in my room and asked me if i was making rooster sounds.
seriously, it's just one of those fucking nights.

<embed width="430" height="389" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" wmode="transparent" src="http://smg.photobucket.com/player.swf?file=http://vidmg.photobucket.com/albums/v70/hotyboomba/everymomentcounts.flv"></embed>

last summer.

good morning.  my mom is out of town, so i'm in charge.  for whatever reason (i accidentally changed my alarm clock to an hour ahead.) i just woke all the boys up at 5:30am. instead of 6:30.  i'm so fucking tired AND such a fucking idiot.  i finally fell asleep last night @ 3:45.

i specifically remember chewing a piece of gum (actually, it was three) earlier but now i have no idea where it is and i don't remember spitting it out.  i know i didn't swallow it, because that would be impossible.  i think i'm losin' it.

so, some of you know that i'm a deacon at my church.   i know i've talked about my love for my church family here before, but seriously,  someone thought that it would be a good idea to make me deacon moderator.  this means i'm like, head deacon.  when they asked me to do it, i knew that it would be talking on a HUGE responsibility (something i like to try to avoid if at all possible) but i thought a lot about it and what i came up with is, that out of all the third year deacons, i'm most qualified. or the most willing to step up.  the problem is,  i feel TOTALLY unprepared and completely NOT qualified.  

ANYWAY,  i guess the point of this whole thing is, i'm supposed to be writing an agenda for tomorrow and organizing care groups, but instead, here i am updating my lj and whining about how not ready i am.  swell.
happy birthday to a beautiful giraffe. <3.
babydog died tonight.  she just wasn't strong enough.

my life (well, the last 2 months) in pictures: november 17, 2006: went on a car rally (basically a scavenger hunt on wheels). my team lost, even though (or perhaps because) our team name was los championes AND we had shirts. november 19, 2006: coolest birthday present evurrrr. puppies. me and meg with other puppies. birthday dinner...clockwise around the table: andrea and aaron the boy, the back of amanda and tantan, my mom, my foster brother christian, my cousin eric, my foster brother andre, bridget, me, part of dhyana, mel, and the back of my foster brother allen's head. clockwise again: my mom, my foster brother christian, my cousin eric, my foster brother andre, bridget, me, my friend dg, dhyana, amanda, tantan, and my foster brother phillip. november 23-27, 2006: went to a wedding up north with all of my friends including my bestest: wore a dress. stopped and saw my sister's fam on the way up. including my disgustingly cute nephews: zachary and matthew. spent some time in san francisco, but for battery reasons, got very few photos... took the coast home. december 2, 2006: hung out with amanda and meg at emily wells cd release and then we went to IHOP with bridget: see? december 3, 2006: went to in-n-out with the krew. l to r: andre, sara, amanda, tantan, me, and eric. took nerdy pictures. (so, what else is new?) december 10-23, 2006: christmas shopped like a crazy person pretty much everyone else in america. hence, the lack of pictures. december 23, 2006: got swanky new ride. the end.
i can't sleep.  mostly because i got a new car for christmas.  i really just want to stand in the driveway and look at it. and say nice things to it and about it.
more and more, i like how i look.

i have an infection in my leg again.  this time it's the other leg.  i've been majorly sick and i'm in a shitton of pain and mostly i feel like no one can understand and i'm really lonely.  maybe just being sick makes me really emotional.  i just laid in bed crying for 20 minutes because i can't get the little shooting pains all over my body to fucking STOP.  i don't know if i can handle this again.  at least i caught it earlier this time and   didn't have to stay in the hospital with IVs and PIC lines and stuff.


amanda, are there any harmful effects to mixing advil and tylenol?

by the time i get home at night i'm almost always too tired to write here. i am still alive and i'm doing well. i hope you all are as well. megan multitasking. melinda. she can wear this shirt pretty much anytime. after the show, right before megan dropped and broke the camera (and then leaned over to pick it up and spilled water on it). so when i met and hugged beth ditto, we had to camera phone it... but, dude, fun times.

who danced/sweated her ass off at a gossip show and got to hug her hero beth ditto tonight?
this girl did.
um, are you kidding me? could this be more offensive? oh wait it can. why is she barefoot?

you have no idea how surreal my life can be sometimes.

it's good, but living with 6 boys is getting really intense.  mainly because 3 of them have been acting like total little assholes.

i'm losing weight like crazy, although i feel really fat today.  fatter than usual.  i think i lost like 20 pounds last week.  insanity.  sometimes i think that if i were to lose all the weight i want to, maybe i'd go crazy.  like, i couldn't handle it or something.  i mainly feel like this when i'm laying in bed at night and i can feel, with my hands, the difference in my body.  the changes that are taking place.  the bones that i ACTUALLY HAVE.  my wrists are smaller, my arms are.  the skin on my legs is looser than it's ever been.  it's gross, but wonderful at the same time.  i know i'm going to need surgery to fix my skin, but i'm not afraid of that.  i rode my bike today for the first time in like 2 years.  i washed it and filled the tires and took it to the park and it was easier to get on than ever before.  i could only ride for like 15 minutes, but that will change. 

i'm getting more motivated to do things for myself.  i'm ready to go back to school.  hopefully next semester.  

i really want a girlfriend.  not need, i'd never say need.  but i think it would be really nice.  i just want someone to talk silly to and be around.  i want closeness and flirting. well i have flirting, but whatever's after that, (it's been so long i barely remember.) i'd really like to have that.  i guess i just want to be wanted.

this is about a week old, but it feels good today:


Dear Tara,
Here is your horoscope
for Monday, September 4:

After a long bout of stagnation, you have a major case of fresh-start fever. The only cure is to keep creating change in all the areas of your life that can use it. Direct your energy onward and upward.

i'm alive. my dickies shorts that didn't fit 6 months ago are pretty much too big. i have a minor crush on an 18 year old. the boys are (pretty much) all back in school. and i have TOO MANY pictures on my computer. of which, right now is pretty much my favorite. mainly because of the look on my face. +no one in that picture is my minor crush.
also, this morning when hiro and nobu left, i cried like a bitch.  shocker.

4 days ago: i gag drinking echinacea and i love japanese exchange students eventhough i don't know why they call them that when i don't get to see japan. maybe next summer, if i somehow become wealthy in the next year. and thinner. wealthy and thinner. i am losing though, i'm down about 50, which on me, isn't really that much, but its better than nothing. tonight was bowling with the students. last night starbucks. we've been doing starbucks kind of a lot because it's a way to get out of the house, and there really isn't anyplace else nearby to sit and drink coffee and smoke cigarettes. last weekend i saw the grand canyon's majesty for the first time. it was pretty majestic. i have this idea that pretty much no americans go to the grand canyon. there were only foreigners there. many beautiful european people and asian people. i went there on a bus of japanese students. i had an amazing and fun time. tonight: hookah with the japanese boys. today was the sayonara party. in the morning (5 hours from now) we say goodbye. it's seriously like losing a close friend. chances are i'll never see them again. this makes me so sad. both of them cried today. in five hours we'll all be crying, i think. i want to see japan more than i ever have before. 1st day. try not to laugh at my dorky bathing suit and glasses. watermelon festival. i like cotton candy. a lot. umm... sayonara party. duh, bob's big boy. slighty reminiscent of last year: yo and shin

i just got sirred.
outside of a 7-11.

before i leave for camping tomorrow i have to:
  • do laundry
  • fix table leg + reattach it
  • make ribs
  • grocery shop
  • make myself a shirt that says "i heart my moho."
  • get life

these are from camping a few weeks ago: TRUE LIFE: during the summer, i go to special camp. l to r: foster brother andre, niece deziree, mom, f.b. dillion, nephew christian, me, nicki from church, pam from church (tanisha's mom), tanisha from church, f.b.'s ashton, phillip, jonathan, christian. the kids table: tanisha at the kids table: (she turned 18 the next day) deziree really wanted to go fishing: mom really wanted dez to go away: for tanisha's birthday we all went into town for dinner...this is titled WHO WANTS ICECREAM? (haha) i DO!! my mom is so cute! this is me and tan-tan at the ice cream place she was so surprised that she actually got to go where she wanted: this is andre: he fell in love with nicki on this trip... she was thrilled: he also fell in love with my nephew christian: i really like birthday hats... birthday hat hairdo #1: birthday hat hairdo #2: birthday hat hairdo #3: on the way back to the car...i found the most ridiculous looking mannequin EVER: and emulated her: that night we took the kids snipe hunting these are the brightest of the bunch, and the ones who'd been before: we didn't catch anything...but boy was it fun(ny): the boys doing what they do best: phil: jon: christian: this is ashton the "goth": except when he's in THIS outfit: yes, this IS my littlest foster brother, christian, roasting hotdogs while wearing a diver mask so that he doesn't get smoke in his eyes: my nephew christian is a little ham: this is him ALL THE WAY INSIDE his pajama shorts: which sort of leads us into the last night camping where tan-tan and nicki decided to dress andre and christian as andrea and christina: fun times that trip was...exhausting, but totally worth it.

i think i'm actually going to sleep tonight because it has cooled off here significantly.  
i still love my new haircut, i'm still really enjoying my summer.

i spent time this weekend with some of my favorite people and it was really awesome.  

i have nothing to complain about and that's really nice.

so, it's cooled down some.  now it's only 89 degrees at 1 in the morning.  seriously, it's to the point where our swimming pool, which isn't heated, is almost not refreshing because it's so warm.  i'm not sure how i feel about this weather.  but i had a fun productive day in spite of it.  i picked up mel and dhyana and we went to get hair cuts (i'm super in love with mine.)  and then we went to this vegan place in little ethiopia and i was pleasantly surprised and then we went to babeland where i FINALLY got to spent my gift card that i got from them for my b-day.  it was a pretty cool day, except for it being like 110 all day.

the weather here from like 7-9 was absolutely INSANE.  around seven everything became very dry and windy. and the sky was like, magnificent..sort of between just this really beautiful sunset and looking like it might rain and thunder.  

too tired.

it's been 9 years since my dad died. i'm constantly baffled by how quickly time goes by as i get older. it seems like yesterday i was graduating from highschool and moving to hawaii (and back.) and driving my dad to dialysis three times a week. more, it seems like yesterday that he was answering the phone this is GOD, who's this? and agreeing with michael that the password was indeed "klondike bar". it seems like yesterday we were swimming in the pool and i was sneaking sips of his beer eventhough i thought it tasted like shit. it seems like yesterday i was pulling off his socks for him after he'd worked all day. or yesterday that he took me and the boys and my friend jenny schnepp to the LA zoo after stopping at aero market for a box full of sandwiches and bazooka joe bubble gum. or bringing me chick-o-stix or necco wafers. i try not to remember any bad stuff, because it wasn't bad enough to damage me. sometimes he yelled, but he wasn't abusive. he only ever laid his hands on me in the form of a finger poke to the chest. he provided for his family. he loved my mom. he said funny shit, my favorites: your ass is sucking canal water. i'm gonna make a foot factory in your fanny. we're gonna have to go to kaiser to get my foot out of your ass. well, we could always open a whore house and run it by hand til we get some girls. he thought he was funnier than he actually was. maybe that's where i get it from. jim foley he wasn't perfect, but people loved him. i hope they say as much about me when i'm gone.

i just need to talk about last weekend before i completely forget. the first night (thursday) i camped by myself. i was not scared. until the next morning when i found out that they found a HUGE rattlesnake at the campsite next to mine just the day before. friday, after much frustration and misery and driving to every campground in 100 mile radius looking for a place to camp, i asked my dad (and dorothy the parking space angel) to help me find a campsite at my favorite place in the whole world and i ended up with the best spot in the whole campground. i spent the weekend with good friends and i enjoyed myself more than i have in a really long time. in spite of a middle of the night toilet over-flow and the rocky start, it was just incredibly amazing. seriously. i got just the right amount of sunburn and spent just the right amount of time on the beach and we were just the right distance from the bathrooms and just the right distance from the shore and i ate just the right amount of junk food and just the right amount of kite flying and just the right amount of pictures. well, no, not enough pictures but, my husband flying a kite. amanda. brandon and katherine makin s'mores. for andrea: cute squirrel eating nuts. carnivorous monster squirrel with gigantic nipples eating rib bones out of the fire place. me pretending to be a squirrel. it was pretty great.

sometimes i wish i lived alone, or at least without foster kids, so i could walk around in my shorts and sports bra.

in other news the husband and i are taking the moho out next weekend to leo carillo. pretty much anyone who wants to come is invited.  it's going to be me, cade, amanda, maybe megan for a bit, and whomever else wants to go.  it should be pretty chill and i'm excited.  cade, amanda, and i are leaving friday around noonish and coming home sunday evening.  umm fun times.
hi.  i've been home for a day and a half.   still recovering.

camping tomorrow.  
it's turned from me and mom and the boys to omg 13 people.
that's, no joke:
mom
me
pam (from church)
tanisha 18 (pam's daughter)
ashton 17
phillip 16
dillion 15
nicki 14 (from church)
jonathan 14
eric 14 (whutup cuz)
andre 13
christian 11 (my nephew)
christian 11 (foster kid)

seriously,  am i insane?


i feel like we're not ready to go.  i KNOW i'm not. i still haven't packed and my room is a HOLY MESS.  and i really should clean it before i go and i need to do a load of laundry still and i know i'm going to forget something...like how to drive or something equally important like omg i have this mental picture of us all running around like crazy people and then accidently leaving someone home alone like macaulay culkin or something.  i should go.

wish me luck.

i just bought a brand new 30gig ipod + an fm car adapter thingy for $250. and i'm going camping (as much as living in a motorhome can be considered camping.) in approximately 4 days. life is pretty good. please recommend your: favorite song as of this moment: favorite song for summer: favorite love song: favorite mopey/emo/break up song: favorite silly song/ song to dance to: absolute guilty pleasure song: thanks!

let's go get slurpees.
call me. 818.352.3414.

so mission possible weekend is when my whole church gets together and chooses several different projects to help out our community. some people work at food kitchens, some people put together groceries for people who need them, some people worked at the children's hunger fund, some cleaned up the trail that goes in front of the church, some made a back yard at a halfway house in to a garden, some made meals in a bag, some (my group) visited the shadow hills convalescent home. it's just cool to see all the things that get done when everyone does something at once. you know? i really enjoyed myself. this is amanda (and rufus) and megan (and my piggy) and my new friend mary. mary is my favorite person in the whole place. meg and amanda like cooookies. this is a blurry but sweet pic of me and the husband. this is scherkey and linda...they're elders. and then this is our whole group: back row: meg, sarah, me, anna, jennifer (with scooter), my favorite bea waterman, eric "whatup cuz" starck (with piggy), art starck, and scherkey (scherkle, sherkleton, the scherklenator, etc..) front row: linda, amanda (with rufus), con lax, cade, drew, scott memmer, and two of my foster brothers jonathan and andre (with rocky). YAY. that's all.

megan graduated from CSUN with her BA in television production. she wins! plus i'm totally proud of her. i was drinking malibu and lemonade.
